channel.title: Java problem!
channel.description:
Ok the story about clients is that every client I download won't work. Mostly saying something along the lines of 'Java is not reconized as a internal or external command' or something close to that. But loading to official RuneScape works no probs. Obviously I must set the client to read my Java files but i've searched through these and found bot all. So any help would be appreciated.
In my Java file i have the following files:
JDK1.6.0 JRE1.6.0 JRE1.6.0_11

item.title: Java problem!
item.dc:creator: @mad_moparscapian mad_moparscapian
item.description:
@mad_moparscapian wrote:

[quote=“Rii0N, post:4, topic:271713”]Testing now. I didnt have a classpath so i created it. Should work all the same right?

Edit: Brilliant, working like a charm now. Wish I could of repped you![/quote]

Don’t worry, I’m glad i could help…I had the exact same problem and i searched for week’s on end

Read full topic

item.title: Java problem!
item.dc:creator: @Rii0N Rii0N
item.description:
@Rii0N wrote:

Testing now. I didnt have a classpath so i created it. Should work all the same right?

Edit: Brilliant, working like a charm now. Wish I could of repped you!

item.title: Java problem!
item.dc:creator: @mad_moparscapian mad_moparscapian
item.description:
@mad_moparscapian wrote:

[quote=“Rii0N, post:1, topic:271713”]Ok the story about clients is that every client I download won’t work. Mostly saying something along the lines of ‘Java is not reconized as a internal or external command’ or something close to that.
But loading to official RuneScape works no probs. Obviously I must set the client to read my Java files but i’ve searched through these and found bot all. So any help would be appreciated.

In my Java file i have the following files:

JDK1.6.0 JRE1.6.0 JRE1.6.0_11[/quote]

Do you have the path’s ???

follow this short guide

  1. Click start
  2. Open my computer
  3. View system information
  4. Open the advanced tab
  5. enviromental variables

Please make back up’s of your Path && CLASSPATH incase this doe not work as i do not want to be held responsible for anything

Now find your path and change everything there to this

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;C:\Program Files\QuickTime\QTSystem\

and then find your CLASSPATH and change it to this

.;C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\ext\QTJava.zip

But remember to make back up’s

That should work…

Hope i helped

Read full topic

item.title: Java problem!
item.dc:creator: @alancarr123 alancarr123
item.description:
@alancarr123 wrote:

Your PATH variable is wrong and maybe your CLASSPATH variable is too.
Access the variables by going to start>computer>properties>enviroment variables>advanced tab
Set Your CLASSPATH As C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Read full topic
